name: RerunFailedGithubWorkflowJobs
description:
Re-run failed jobs in a GitHub workflow run.

This tool re-runs all failed jobs and their dependents in a specified GitHub workflow run. Use this when a workflow has failed jobs you want to attempt again. Authentication with a token having `repo` scope is required.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the GitHub repository. This is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: workflow_run_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the GitHub workflow run to re-run failed jobs for.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run.

parameters.name: enable_debug_logging
parameters.description: Enable debug logging for the re-run of failed workflow jobs.

value_schema.description: Whether to enable debug logging for the re-run.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run.

parameters.name: enable_debug_logging
